metadata.title: CVE-2017-6347 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The ip_cmsg_recv_checksum function in net/ipv4/ip_sockglue.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.10.1 has incorrect expectations about skb data layout,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted system calls, asdemonstrated by use of the MSG_MORE flag in conjunction with loopback UDPtransmission.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
